item.title: Nick Markakis' Defense is Really Bad
item.description: Nick Markakis’ defense is really, really bad. That’s it, that’s the post. A couple things stand out to me. Take the Astros and Yankees. The Astros have a hump at around 80 or so wrc+, but over half their team is >100 and is pretty evenly distributed up to the 150 or so range. The number of >150 wrc+ hitters in their lineup is unheard of across the league and is a big reason why they lead the league with the team average of 122.

item.title: WRC+ Distributions
item.description: Weighted Runs Created Plus or wrc+ is a nice stat for analyzing relative hitter performance for a certain year. It’s relative because it is scaled to every hitter in the league for that season. So, an average hitter has a wrc+ of 100. This makes it interesting to look at a team’s wrc+ distribution to see how many good hitters they have. You can see the league wrc+ distribution is fairly evenly distributed.

item.title: Barrel percent by launch angle
item.description: Data from this post retreived via the fabulous baseballr package from Bill Petti. It has a number of data acquisition and other functions. Here, I used the baseballr::scrape_savant_leaderboards() function to fetch data from the MLB’s baseball savant website for exit velocity as measured by Statcast.
